meanings.definition: To surpass in pity or compassion.
meanings.sent1: She outpities all her friends when it comes to helping others.
meanings.sent2: He always outpities his siblings by offering a helping hand.
meanings.sent3: The kind-hearted girl outpities even the saddest puppy in the shelter.
meanings.sent4: Her empathy outpities the capacity of most people to understand.
meanings.sent5: His compassion outpities any measure of comparison.

meanings.definition: To feel more pity or compassion than someone else.
meanings.sent1: I outpities my friend whenever she talks about her struggles.
meanings.sent2: She often outpities her classmates when they share their difficulties.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outpities his cat when it meows for more food.
meanings.sent4: Her heart outpities the ocean's depth when she sees someone in need.
meanings.sent5: His kindness outpities any expectation one might have.
